rtega_mnemonic:
奧奧RS
奥奥		mysterious, obscure, profound, heart, interior
  • RS. sorting rice from rocks 釆/米 in (the interior of) the house 宀 with the hands 大
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 奥)
Ideographic: A person 大 discovering a house full of rice 釆
purpleculture_examples:
奧運會 [ ào yùn huì ]: abbr. for 奥林匹克运动会 ; Olympic Games; the Olympics
奧祕 [ ào mì ]: secret; mystery
奧委會 [ ào wěi huì ]: Olympic committee
奧妙 [ ào miào ]: marvelous; mysterious; profound; marvel; wonder
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⿵ Surround from above
      • 釆 [ biàn ] to distinguish; to pick, to gather, to collect
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
heisig_chinese_memo: If you wear this magic helmet you can have a conversation of great depth with your St. Bernard dog.  Not just discussions about a drop of droppings he sniffed.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the core of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way of great depth (deep and smart in this case) to get power from rice, by making it pent in under high pressure. It's very dangerous, so they've trained a st. bernard dog to run things, he's adding more drops of rice as necessary.
humanum_full_description_en:
Same as " 𡪃 ", from the sound of "宀" and" 𢍏 ", the original meaning is the southwest corner of the room. "Shuowen": "Wan Ye. The southwest corner of the room. From the 宀, 𢍏 sound." "Ritual ‧ Shaolao Feeding Ceremony": "Sigong feast in Austria, I wish to set a few on the feast, right. Zheng Xuan's note: "The southwest corner of the room is called the mystery."

" Ao " also refers to the depths of the room. "Huainanzi‧ Shizexun": "The cool breeze begins, and crickets are in Austria."

" Ao " also refers to the inner room. Han Kong Rong, "Recommended Ni Heng Biao": "Introduction to art and literature, and rise to the vogue."

" Ao " also refers to hidden places. Han Yangxiong's "Tai Xuan‧ Wen": "The chief examines his relatives, but he opposes his secrets."

" O " also means deep. "Selected Works-Cai Yong "Guo Youdao Stele"": "Hao Haoyan, Wang Wangyan, Austria is unfathomable." Li Shan's note: "Unfathomable."

" Ao " can also refer to mystery and subtlety. "Preface to the Book": "As for the books of Xia, Shang, and Zhou, although the teaching is not correct, the profound meanings of "Ya" and "Gao" are unified."
humanum_short_description_en: Same as " 𡪃 ", from the sound of "宀" and " 𢍏 ", the original meaning is the southwest corner of the room.
humanum_full_description:
同「𡪃」，從「宀」，「𢍏」聲，本義為室內西南隅。《說文》：「宛也。室之西南隅。从宀，𢍏聲。」 《儀禮‧少牢饋食禮》：「司宮筵於奧，祝設几於筵上，右之。」鄭玄注：「室中西南隅謂之奧。」

　　「奧」也泛指室內深處。《淮南子‧時則訓》：「涼風始至，蟋蟀居奧。」

　　「奧」亦指內室。漢孔融〈薦禰衡表〉：「初涉藝文，升堂睹奧。」

　　「奧」還指隱秘處。漢揚雄《太玄‧文》：「酋考其親，冥反其奧。」

　　「奧」也表示深。《文選‧蔡邕〈郭有道碑〉》：「浩浩焉，汪汪焉，奧乎不可測已。」李善注：「深不可測。」

　　「奧」還可指奧妙、微妙。《〈書〉序》：「至於夏、商、周之書，雖設教不倫，《雅》《誥》奧義，其歸一揆。」
humanum_short_description: 同「𡪃」，從「宀」，「𢍏」聲，本義為室內西南隅。

Original meaning 本义: Meaning obscure, as in can't see well.

English senses 英语理解: mysterious, obscure, profound

Chinese: If you wear this magic helmet you can have a conversation of great depth with your St. Bernard dog. Not just discussions about a drop of droppings he sniffed.
Meaning: of great depth

Story: In the core of a nuclear reactor, scientists have discovered a way of great depth (deep and smart in this case) to get power from rice, by making it pent in under high pressure. It's very dangerous, so they've trained a st. bernard dog to run things, he's adding more drops of rice as necessary.
Kind: traditional

同「 𡪃 」，從「 宀 」，「 𢍏 」聲，本義為室內西南隅。《說文》：「宛也。室之西南隅。从宀，𢍏聲。」 《儀禮‧少牢饋食禮》：「司宮筵於奧，祝設几於筵上，右之。」鄭玄注：「室中西南隅謂之奧。」 「 奧 」也泛指室內深處。《淮南子‧時則訓》：「涼風始至，蟋蟀居奧。」 「 奧 」亦指內室。漢孔融〈薦禰衡表〉：「初涉藝文，升堂睹奧。」 「 奧 」還指隱秘處。漢揚雄《太玄‧文》：「酋考其親，冥反其奧。」 「 奧 」也表示深。《文選‧蔡邕〈郭有道碑〉》：「浩浩焉，汪汪焉，奧乎不可測已。」李善注：「深不可測。」 「 奧 」還可指奧妙、微妙。《〈書〉序》：「至於夏、商、周之書，雖設教不倫，《雅》《誥》奧義，其歸一揆。」
Same as " 𡪃", from the sound of " 宀" and" 𢍏", the original meaning is the southwest corner of the room. "Shuowen": "Wan Ye. The southwest corner of the room. From the 宀, 𢍏 sound." "Ritual ‧ Shaolao Feeding Ceremony": "Sigong feast in Austria, I wish to set a few on the feast, right. Zheng Xuan's note: "The southwest corner of the room is called the mystery." " Ao" also refers to the depths of the room. "Huainanzi‧ Shizexun": "The cool breeze begins, and crickets are in Austria." " Ao" also refers to the inner room. Han Kong Rong, "Recommended Ni Heng Biao": "Introduction to art and literature, and rise to the vogue." " Ao" also refers to hidden places. Han Yangxiong's "Tai Xuan‧ Wen": "The chief examines his relatives, but he opposes his secrets." " O" also means deep. "Selected Works-Cai Yong "Guo Youdao Stele"": "Hao Haoyan, Wang Wangyan, Austria is unfathomable." Li Shan's note: "Unfathomable." " Ao" can also refer to mystery and subtlety. Liushutong characters (5)

奧字的基本解释

奧
ào
同“奥”。

奧
yù
同“奥”。

奧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［ào］
［《廣韻》烏到切，去号，影。］
“奧1”的新字形。亦作“2”。
(1)室内西南隅。古时祭祀设神主或尊长居坐之处。
(2)泛指内室。
(3)泛指室内深处。
(4)指隐秘处。
(5)深。
(6)奥妙；微妙。
(7)犹内。参见“奥内”。
(8)犹主，主事人。
(9)指主管的职事。
(10)猪圈。
(11)灶神。
(12)通“嶴”。山近水的地方。
(13)姓。
(14)奥斯忒的省称。磁场强度单位。为纪念丹麦物理学家奥斯忒（HansChristianOersted）而命名。
[②]［yù］
［《集韻》乙六切，入屋，影。］
“奧2”的新字形。
(1)后作“燠”。暖。
(2)通“澳”。水边深曲之处。
(3)通“澳”。污浊。
(4)后作“墺”、“隩”。谓可以定居的地方。
(5)后作“”。腌制。
(6)见“奥2李”。

奧字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【大字部】　奧； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页253第19
【唐韻】烏到切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】於到切，?音墺。室西南隅，人所安息也。【禮·曲禮】爲人子者，居不主奧。【禮運】人情以爲田，故人以爲奧也。　又五祀之祭。【饒雙峰曰】五祀，先設主席，而祭于其所，親之也。後迎尸而祭于奧，尊之也。　又官職。【東觀漢記】桓帝時，初置祕書監，宜掌祕奧。　又積聚。【周語】野無奧草。　又烹和也。【荀子·大略篇】泔之傷人，不若奧之。　又山名。【山海經】丑陽之東三百里曰奧山，奧水出焉。　又七亂切，音竄。爨神也。【禮·禮運】奧者，老婦之祭也。【註】奧，當作爨，祭至尸食竟而祭爨神，其神則先炊也，故謂之老婦。　又【正韻】乙六切，音郁。隈也。水內曰奧。與澳隩通。　又與燠同。【詩·小雅】日月方奧。【前漢·五行志】厥罰常奧。　从宀从釆。俗作奥，非。【正字通】字彙廾部?，音訓重出，今倂于此。說文奧从宀?聲。宷，从宀从釆。从宀从釆或从凢从釆不成字。

奧字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
奧字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［ào］
["Guangyun" Wu to cut, go to the number, shadow. ]
The new font of "奥1". Also called "2".
(1) The southwest corner of the interior. In ancient times, there was a place where gods or lords lived for worship.
(2) Refers to the inner chamber in general.
(3) Refers to the deep part of the room.
(4) Refers to hidden places.
(5) Deep.
(6) Mystery; subtle.
(7) Just inside. See "Onet".
(8) The Lord Jude, the principal.
(9) Refers to the office of a supervisor.
(10) Pigpen.
(11) Kitchen God.
(12) Through "Ao". Mountain  near the water.
(13) Last name.
(14) The provincial name of Osté. The unit of magnetic field strength. Named in honor of the Danish physicist Hans Christian Oersted.
[②]［yù］
["Ji Yun" B and six cuts, enter the house, shadow. ]
The new font of "奥2".
(1) Later called "燠". warm.
(2) Through "Australia". Deeply curved on the water's edge.
(3) Through "Australia". Dirty.
(4) Later as "墺" and "隩". It is a place where you can settle down.
(5) Subsequent to "". Pickled.
(6) See "Ao 2 Lee".

[Li Yun] People think that people think of fields, so people think that they are also Austrian.　Another sacrifice of five sacrifices. [Rao Shuangfeng said] For the Five Sacrifices, the chairman is established first, and the sacrifice is made at his place, and he is also close to him. After welcoming the corpse and offering sacrifices to Austria, it is also respected.　An official position again. [Eastern View of Han Dynasty] In Emperor Huan’s time, he set up a secretarial supervisor for the first time, and he should be in charge of the secrets.　Accumulate again. [Zhou Yu] There is no arcane in the wild.　Cooking and cooking again. [Xunzi·A Brief Introduction] Sickness hurts people, but it's not so mysterious.　Also the name of the mountain. [Shanhaijing] Three hundred miles east of Chouyang is called Aoshan, and the water flows out of Yan.　 Seven chaotic cuts, sound channeling. Cuan God also. 【Rite·Rite Fortune】Austrian, the sacrifice of old women. [Note] Ao, as a cuan, sacrifice to the god of cuan until the corpse eats, and the god first cooks, so it is called an old woman.　[Zheng Yun] B-Six cut, the sound is gloomy. Kumaya. The water inside is said to be Austrian. Connect with Australia.　Same as Rin again. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Fangao from the sun and the moon. [Former Han·Five Elements] Jue punishes Chang Ao.　Cong Luo Cong 釆.
